titles.en: Chapter 18 – Abhorrence of staying in Makkah
Chapter 18 – Abhorrence of staying in Makkah

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ وَ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ الْعَلَاءِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يَنْبَغِي لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يُقِيمَ بِمَكَّةَ سَنَةً قُلْتُ كَيْفَ يَصْنَعُ قَالَ يَتَحَوَّلُ عَنْهَا وَ لَا يَنْبَغِي لِأَحَدٍ أَنْ يَرْفَعَ بِنَاءً فَوْقَ الْكَعْبَةِ. وَ رُوِيَ أَنَّ الْمُقَامَ بِمَكَّةَ يُقْسِي الْقُلُوبَ

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, and Safwan, from Al A’ala, from Muhammad Bin Muslim, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘It is not befitting for the man that he stays in Makkah for a year’. I said, ‘How should he deal with it?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘’He should transfer from it. And, it is not befitting for anyone that he raises a construction above the Kabah’.
And it is reported that the staying in Makkah hardens the hearts’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَمَّنْ ذَكَرَهُ عَنْ ذَرِيحٍ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِذَا فَرَغْتَ مِنْ نُسُكِكَ فَارْجِعْ فَإِنَّهُ أَشْوَقُ لَكَ إِلَى الرُّجُوعِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from the one who mentioned it, from Zareeh, from Abu Baseer, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘When you are free from performing your rituals, return, for it would be more desirous for you to the returning’.
